line_1: Or who wou'd ask for her Opinion
line_2: Between an Oyster, and an Onion?

line_1: (The ladies give audience to hear his opinion)
line_2: This book, says he, (snift, snift) has in the beginning,
At me, thy poor, earth-born companion,

line_1: From whose Remarks I give Opinion
line_2: On twenty Books, yet ne'er look in One.
Is seen from Tickell's letters to Avignon.
For Pompous Names, or wide Dominion;

line_1: Said Thomas to Richard — to speak my opinion,
line_2: There is not such a bitch in king George's dominion!

line_1: To rule by dint of dark opinion;

line_2: You'd do the very same, my minion.

line_1: Prone to adopt and lead some new opinion,
line_2: Spurning restraint, and grasping at dominion;
